author.name: Bryan Berry - Nathen Harvey - Matt Ray

entry.title: Test Kitchen 1.x
entry.content:
Join our panelists as we discuss Test Kitchen!

Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Audio
    • Video

Panel

  • Fletcher Nichol twitter, github
  • JJ Asghar github, twitter, blog, irc: j2
  • Jonathan Hartman github, twitter, irc: roboticcheese - Jon was able to join us almost long enough to introduce himself ;(
  • Joshua Timberman github, twitter, blog
  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter, blog
  • Salim Afiune github, twitter
  • Scott Pustay github, twitter, blog
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline

Chef News

Upcoming Events

  • Chef Community Summit - October 2 & 3 - FOODFIGHT saves 10%

  • Chef Community Summit London - October 15 & 16 - FOODFIGHT saves 10%

  • DevOpsDays Chicago - October 7 & 8 - The Food Fight Show is a Media Sponsor code FOODFIGHT10 will save you 10% off!

  • VMWorld - August 24 - 28

  • Chef and Azure Webinar - August 27
  • FlowCon - September 3 & 4
  • Managing Containers with Chef - Webinar - September 10
  • Fossetcon - September 11 - 13
  • Velocity New York - September 15-17
  • PowerShell DSC at Chef-NYC Meetup - September 17
  • Chef Analytics Webinar - September 17
  • Beyond the Code - September 19 in Ottawa Canada

  • PowerShell Summit EU - September 29 through October 1 in Amsterdam, The Netherlands

  • DevOpsDays

    • Toronto - September 12 & 13
    • New York City - September 19
    • Warsaw - September 25 & 26
    • Tel Aviv - September 29 & 30
    • Berlin - October 23 & 24
    • Belgium - October 27 & 28 - Five year anniversary
    • Vancouver - November 14 & 15

Upcoming Chef Training

Use discount code FOODFIGHT to save 10% off upcoming Chef training that’s being held in

  • Austin
  • Bangalore
  • Chennai
  • Denver
  • Phoenix
  • Raleigh
  • San Francisco
  • Seattle

There are also a number of classes being offered online.

Show Notes

Here’s a brief outline of some of the things we’d like to discuss. Add your ideas to the show notes.

  • kitchen.ci
    • What is Test Kitchen?
    • Why Test Kitchen?
    • Walk us through a .kitchen.yml file
    • How does one get started with Test Kitchen?
    • How does one extend Test Kitchen?
    • Terms
      • driver
      • provisioner
      • platforms
      • suites
      • bussers; and the magic behind them
  • How are the Chef Development Kit and Test Kitchen related?
  • Interesting use cases for test-kitchen. Leveraging drivers to do development in the cloud when local machine restrictions won’t allow for vagrant/vmware.
  • Does TK have any support for evaluating idempotence and/or run performance?
    • Testing Idempotence for Infrastructure as Code
  • Test Kitchen & Windows Guest? Uhmmm is that possible?
  • How do bussers work? Are they run from the host machine or on the machine under test?
  • Chef Cookbook Development Workflow RFC

Picks

Fletcher

  • ChefSpec
  • The Goal, especially the audio book version
  • Walking (the exercise, you know, get up from your desk)

JJ

  • Sean O’Meara: Cookbook Unit and Acceptance Testing
  • The Game of Thrones board game
  • Cold Brew Coffee

Jonathan

  • The Wirecutter
  • CircleCI
  • Tom Duffield’s Chef-Container Talk

Joshua

  • RFC - Homebrew As OS X Default Package Provider
  • Chef Issue - Homebrew As OS X Default Package Provider
  • Homebrew Cask
  • The Complete Joy of Homebrewing
  • Chef reporting API and the knife-reporting gem

Salim

  • Moonwalking with Einstein

Scott

  • Little sumpin’ from Lagunitas

Mike

  • Blue Apron

Nathen

  • Chef Developers’ IRC Meetings
  • Taking a proper vacation: leave your phone and computer at home.
  • Not being an asshole on social media or anywhere else, for that matter.

Download

  • Audio
  • Video

The Food Fight Show is brought to you by Bryan Berry and Nathen Harvey with help from other hosts and the awesome community of Chefs.

The show is sponsored, in part, by Chef.

Feedback, suggestions, and questions: info@foodfightshow.com or http://github.com/foodfight/showz.

entry.title: Chef Metal
entry.content:
Join us as we discuss chef-metal with it’s creator, John Keiser

Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Audio
    • Video

Panel

  • John Keiser github, twitter
  • Dafydd Crosby github, twitter, blog
  • Matt Wrock github, twitter, blog
  • Ranjib Dey github, twitter, blog
  • Matt Ray github, twitter, irc: mattray, blog
  • Brandon Burton github, twitter
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline

Chef News

  • Managing Windows Servers with Chef - A new book by John Ewart
  • DockerCon - June 9-10
  • Chef Fundamentals Webinar Series
  • Texas Linux Fest - June 13-14
    • Chef Workshop - June 13
  • Austin Chef Meetup - June 18
  • Velocity - June 24-26
    • Chef hack day at Velocity
  • DevOpsDays Silicon Valley - June 27-28
  • Upcoming Training
    • Boston - June 16-17
    • DC - June 18-19
    • Online - Windows class - June 23-25
    • San Francicso - June 25-26
    • London - June 26-27

Show Notes

  • chef-metal - A library for creating machines and infrastructures idempotently in Chef.
    • Drivers
      • Chef Metal: Automate Your Whole Cluster In Chef - #ChefConf 2014 Presentation on Chef Metal
  • spiceweasel - Generates Chef knife commands from a simple JSON or YAML file.
    • Clusters
    • Code Smell
  • Running Recipes (Provisioning)
  • Using chef-metal in action (Use cases)
    • chef-mental and test-kitchen
    • Orchestration
  • Getting Started with chef-metal
  • Autoscaling
  • chef-metal-fog - a Fog provisioner for chef-metal

Picks

John Keiser

  • The Berkshelf Internal API
  • Harry Potter and the Methods of Rationality by Less Wrong

Dafydd Crosby

  • chef-metal
  • OpenBSD
  • Test-Driven Infrastructure with Chef: Bring behaviour-driven development to infrastructure as code by Stephen Nelson-Smith

  • ThinkPad X1 Carbon Ultrabook
  • Ubuntu on Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Carbon 2nd

Matt Ray

  • Pete Cheslock: 17th Century Shipbuilding and Your Failed Software Project

Brandon Burton

  • Rebuilding a Bird in Flight
  • The Riftwar Cycle

Nathen Harvey

  • Pittsburgh!
  • From Hero to Zero

entry.title: Best Practices with Chef
entry.content:
Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Audio
    • Video

Panel

  • Dylan Northrup twitter, github, blog
  • Kris Buytaert twitter, github, blog
  • John Vincent, aka Lusis twitter, github
  • Julian Dunn twitter, github
  • Tom Robison twitter
  • Bryan Berry github, twitter, irc: bryanwb, blog: devopsanywhere
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline

FOSDEM & Configuration Management Camp EU

Kris joins us to discuss FOSDEM and the Configuration Management Camp conferences. CFP for the FOSDEM Configuration Management Dev Room closes on 8 Dec and the CFP for Configuration Management Camp closes on 15 December. Submit your talks today!

Fletcher Nichol and Test Kitchen 1.0! Check out the Getting Started Guide!

  • Introductions
  • Best Practices
    • Whipuptitude! i.e. the aptitude for whipping things up
    • Reasonability
    • Sane Defaults
    • Flexibility
    • Manipulexity - Manipulation of Complex Things
  • Shuhari
    • shu - “obey” - traditional wisdom
    • ha - “detach” - break with tradition
    • ri - “separate” - transcend
    • first learn, then detach, and finally transcend
  • Ruby DSL or JSON DSL?
    • Roles
    • Environments
    • Metadata
  • Use Roles or not?
    • Julian Dunn: Chef Roles Arenâ€™t Evil
  • Should an individual node have more than one item in its run-list?
  • Nesting Roles
  • Environment Specific Run-lists
  • Getting Help
  • Source Code Management
    • is git THE answer?
  • Attirbute precedence levels - there are 15. Which should be used / avoided?
    • Scalar Values, Arrays & Hashes
  • Databags & Sensitive Data
    • Use or not?
    • Encrypted Data Bags - when, where, and how is it appropriate to use them?
    • Encrypted Data Bags, Chef Vault - how to decide best solution?
    • Food Fight Show on Chef Vault
  • Community / Reusable Cookbooks
    • Are reusable cookbooks a myth?
    • Cross-platform cookbooks?
    • Cookbooks without recipes
    • Community Cookbooks blog post
  • Ruby!
    • rbenv, chruby, rvm or omnibus ruby?

Picks

Brandon

  • this gif
  • GoAdvent 2013
  • SysAdvent 2013

Dylan

  • Hex TCG - Digital Trading Card Game. Currently in Alpha, but available to folks who backed their Kickstarter and folks who donate.
  • Tested.com - Geeky maker focused site done in conjunction with Adam Savage and Jamie Hyneman from the Mythbusters.

Kris

  • Duvel
  • In Search of Certainty - The Science of Our Information Infrastructure by Mark Burgess
  • De Gekroonde Hoofden

Julian

  • Bento
  • FreeBSD
  • NYU ITP Winter Show

Tom

  • The poise Cookbook
  • Boulevard Wheat Beer

Bryan

  • Foodfight Future of DevOps
  • Bob Lee’s presentation Engineering Excellence on Square’s technology stack
  • Eclipse Moonrise

Nathen

  • SCaLE 12x - CFP is closing on 15 December.
  • #ChefConf 2014 - CFP closes in mid-January. Ticket prices go up at the end of the calendar year so lock-in the best rate now.
  • Community Cookbooks blog post

Fletcher

  • The Test Kitchen Getting Started Guide
  • serverspec
  • The Phoenix Project: A Novel About IT, DevOps, and Helping Your Business also Food Fight Show: The Phoenix Project! =D

Lusis

  • Omnibus
  • Lua

John

  • chef-sugar
  • chef-rbenv
  • Customizing Chef!

entry.title: Livin' on the Edge with Al Tobey
entry.content:
Join us as we discuss how to test your distributed system in production with Al Tobey

Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Chef News
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Audio
    • Video

Panel

  • Al Tobey, Open Source Mechanic at Datastax github, twitter
  • Bryan Berry github, twitter, irc: bryanwb, blog: devopsanywhere
  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter, blog

Outline

  • Introductions
  • Practice Makes Perfect: Extreme Cassandra Optimization
  • cassandra
  • Apache Cassandra Wiki
  • Cassandra vs Riak
  • DataStax and Cassandra
  • Red Hat
  • MongoDB
  • Oracle JDK and OpenJDK
  • Optimization
  • Third-Party Integration
  • Red Hat and Twitter
  • How Cassandra Deals with the Heap Space Issue
  • Read Ahead
  • Starting Points
  • System D
  • File Systems

Picks

  • Visit Opscode During VMWorld - Opscode will be on the exhibit floor during VMWorld, August 25th-28th. If youâ€™re at the show be sure to stop by grab a sticker and chat about your automation project, with Chef or otherwise. Youâ€™ll find us in booth #1748. See you at the conference!

entry.title: Packer
entry.content:
Join us as we discuss Packer with Mitchell Hashimoto

Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Chef News
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Audio
    • Video

Panel

  • Mitchell Hashimoto github, twitter
  • Brandon Burton github, twitter

  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter, blog
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Chef News

  • Infrastructure upgrades with Chef - A blog post from Etsy on how they roll-out minor changes to their infrastructure using knife-spork and knife-flip. The post also details how they roll-out larger changes with feature flags using chef-whitelist, a library cookbook for implementing feature flags.
  • We are the Operations team at Etsy. Ask us anything! - A Q&A session with the Operations team at Etsy run via reddit.
  • The Importance of Dependency Testing

  • Awesome Community Chef: Mike Fiedler â€“ â€œRoller Derbies & Cookbook Versionsâ€

  • Opscode Community Summit - Join us November 12-13 in Seattle to share your ideas, triumphs, and challenges with Chef or other personal projects. Space is limited so register today!

Outline

  • Chef News
  • Introductions
  • HashiCorp
  • The State of Vagrant
  • What is Packer
  • Developing Packer
  • The Go Programming Language
  • JSON
  • Creating Images/Virtual Boxes
  • veewee
  • veewee-to-packer
  • Packer Workflow:
    • Download Packer
    • Write your template
    • Builder brings up a machine
    • Provisioner installs software (upload files, chef, puppet, etc.)
    • Builder shuts thing down and packages things up
    • With the template you run packer build
    • Artifacts
    • Builders produce artifact your template
    • Post-processor takes an artifact and outputs a new artifact
    • Builds
  • Mistakes made in Vagrant
  • Work on Packer vs work on Vagrant
  • Is Packer Stable?
  • Is the Chef Provisioner Included with the Packer Distribution?
  • Contributors
  • Parallel Builds Feature
  • Editing a configuration and building packer images workflow
  • rpc
  • Box Versioning

entry.title: Immutable Infrastructure
entry.content:
Show Date: July 22, 2013

Join us as we discuss Immutable Infrastructure with Chad Fowler.

This episode was inspired by Chad’s recent blog post on Immutable Infrastructure. For some additional thoughts on the subject, check-out Mike Fiedler’s #ChefConf talk: Treating Your Infrastructure Like Garbage.

Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Chef News
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Audio
    • Video

Panel

  • Chad Fowler twitter, github, blog
  • Craig Tracey twitter, github, blog
  • Fletcher Nichol twitter, github
  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter, blog
  • Ranjib Dey github, twitter, blog
  • Bryan Berry github, twitter, irc: bryanwb, blog: devopsanywhere
  • Brandon Burton github, twitter
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Chef News

  • DevOps Toolbox: Introduction - a series of blog posts from Christopher Laco that walks through many tools used with Chef. The series starts with installing pre-requisites like XCode, Ruby, and VirtualBox. Throughout the series, you’ll learn about Veewee, Vagrant, Chef Solo, Hosted Chef, and more!

  • Gusteau - a tasteful Chef Solo wrapper and configuration manager. This is a gem that aims to provide chef solo users with a more efficent workflow. It looks like an abstraction on top of Vagrant, Berkshelf, and Chef that makes it easier to get started with these various tools.

  • kitchen-docker

Outline

  • Chef News
  • Introductions
  • Chad Fowler: Trash Your Servers and Burn Your Code: Immutable Infrastructure and Disposable Components
  • Article Summary

  • Autoscaling

  • Homeostasis
  • Keeping Log Files
